intro: Russeggera collina, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a perennial flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which help reduce water loss. Russeggera collina is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to high-altitude environments.
